alert.note: Alert for George; Greene (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 04 at 12:41AM CST by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 AM CST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Mississippi, including the following counties, George, Greene, Perry and Stone. * WHEN...Until 645 AM CST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain has fallen so far since Tuesday evening. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 3 inches are expected over the area with the incoming storms over the next couple of hours. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Wiggins, Lucedale, Leakesville, Perkinston, McHenry, Benndale, Dale, Avent, Deep Creek, Crossroads, Leaf, Merrill, Bexley, Ramsey Springs, Progress, Barbara, Oak Grove, Whites Crossing, Big Level and Evanston.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
